hypothesis_content.title: ETH Gas Spike -> ETH Price Mean Reversion (Neutral Regime)
hypothesis_content.statement: When ETH gas fees (7-day avg) spike >2 standard deviations above their 30-day average during NEUTRAL regime, ETH price will experience a short-term mean reversion downward within 3 trading days as high transaction costs temporarily suppress demand.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme gas fees create friction for DeFi/NFT activity, temporarily reducing ETH utility demand. Historically, gas spikes during neutral periods precede 1-3 day pullbacks before normalization.
entry_conditions: Enter short ETH/USD or long ETH put options

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH price drops to 20D MA - 0.5 * ATR(14)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH price breaks above 20D MA + 1 * ATR(14)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETH price continues rallying >5% despite sustained high gas fees, indicating strong fundamental demand overriding transaction cost concerns.
